If TomÃ¡Å¡ approves...

maintainer merge
bors d+

I just realized that `fun_prop` stores only one composition theorem for each function property. This is true for any lambda theorem (_id,_const,_comp,_pi,_apply). Thus this this theorem clashes with `ContinuousOn.comp''` and `ContinuousOn.comp'`.

The current behavior is that only the latest lambda theorem is used. I think it is ok to keep it marked as `fun_prop` for now. I will add a support for multiple variants of lambda theorems, I already have this working for `fun_trans` so it should be quite easy.

```suggestion
* `Polynomial.tendsto_norm_atTop`: `fun x â†¦ â€–Polynomial.eval (z x) pâ€–` tends to infinity provided that
  `fun x â†¦ â€–z xâ€–` tends to infinity and `0 < degree p`;
```
Aren't we moving towards `fun` as the standard?

Correctly rewrapped:
```suggestion
* `Polynomial.tendsto_norm_atTop`: `fun x â†¦ â€–Polynomial.eval (z x) pâ€–` tends to infinity provided
  that `fun x â†¦ â€–z xâ€–` tends to infinity and `0 < degree p`;
```
